name: Dukes Hotel

reviews.text: Dukes Hotel is in a quiet cul de sac off a side street in St James's - unless you know where it is you would never find it. It is, however, handily placed for Piccadilly and the shopping streets of Bond Street, Regent street and Oxford Street and is a 5 minute stroll to either Green Park or Piccadilly tube stations.
reviews.title: Hidden Gem

reviews.text: The hotel tries - and succeeds - in exuding an English country house air - amazing considering nearly all the staff aren't English. Rooms and public areas are all furnished to a very high standard and kept immaculately. Because of its position a quiet night's rest is assured. Drawbacks are very few - the public areas are relatively small - lounges, bars and restaurant are restricted due to the overall size of the property and, of course, rooms are highly priced.
reviews.title: very quiet, central location, small room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dukes is very similar in style to Browns half a mile away on the other side of Piccadilly. Of the two, I would probably opt for Browns because of the superior public areas but it really is a matter of taste. If you do stay at Dukes I am sure you will not be disappointed.
reviews.title: Wedding weekend at the Dukes.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the space is well used but rather confined. the toilet's location is challenged by the bathroom door
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel in London

reviews.text: the tv is on a table that almost prohibits getting out of bed to pass nevertheless is is comfortable, very quiet and an excellent location
reviews.title: Lost the old charm

reviews.text: I had a great stay at Dukes last week - great service and a really lovely room which was beautifully quiet tucked away in the centre of London. Such a good location.
reviews.title: Brilliant stay

reviews.text: Thanks Dukes - I would recommend you unhesitatingly.
reviews.title: Fantastic!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have just arrived home from a stay in the Dukes and will definitely be going back. Steeped in history, beautiful and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Sheer luxury!! The martini bar was a real treat but unfortunately on our second visit my husband was refused entry due to dress code. Rather frustrating as we pointed out others in the bar not complying to the dress code - so beware. Quiet location but so handy and within walking distance of everything we wanted to see.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel but

reviews.text: We stayed for 5 days at the Dukes. It is a fabulous hotel; great service. Loved the Martini bar and do not even drink Martinis. Staff friendly and very helpful. Room and bathroom and immaculate but, at these prices, surely all rooms should at least be big enough to accommodate an armchair. Rather cramped for a longish stay.
reviews.title: Stuff...but perfect if you like that sort of thing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dukes Hotel is classic British refinery in a boutique setting. Think floral wallpapers, matching bedspreads and curtains, and mint green carpet runners. I have no complaints about this place, and they make a mean and famous martini table-side a la guacamole in the lobby bar, but overall this place was just not my style as it is extremely stuffy (but not pretentious), just very Mr. Belvedere. Rooms are spacious as are the bathrooms. Staff is excellent. Tucked away down a small street just off the beaten path of Picadilly off of St. James. Not conveniently located, but decidedly discreet and quiet. Fortnum & Mason, Mayfair shopping are a 5 - 10 min walk.
reviews.title: Wow!!

reviews.text: Having recently stayed at this hotel with my wife and 2 children it ticked all of our boxes. Fabulous trendy rooms, ideal for 2 kids as interconnecting. Modern and chic. Great location, staff really helpful and lovely. Breakfast yummy. Would definitely recommend it.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.text: Dukes is a gorgeous Hotel on a very quite street in central London. The rooms are very cozy and recently updated. The staff was helpful. Close to the tube. Walking distance to everything (Westminster, Big Ben, The Eye, and of course Buckingham Place) It's a little hard to find but worth the search. Did not try the new resturant, seemed a little stuffy but I'm sure the food is good.
reviews.title: gorgeous and centrally located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked Dukes for two reasons 1) had heard good reviews and 2) managed to get a good deal on latelondon.com
reviews.title: So disappointed.........

reviews.text: We were up town celebrating a friends 40th and pre-warned the hotel that we would not be arriving for check in until after 10pm which they said would be no problem at all. First part of check in was ok, until my husband tried to confirm the contents of our booking. Our rate included breakfast and a bottle of champagne. Unfortunatley the staff member that checked us in could not find confirmation of this and proceeded to argue with my husband that we had in fact just booked a room only!!!! After 15mins or so we daid that due to it being late in the evening we would sort out in the morning. My husband called reception first thing in the morning and the morning reception staff managed to confirm our package immediately (which did include breakfast and champagne). How the night staff had not managed to find the information I do not know. I feel the night staff (wished I had taken a note of his name to officially complain) was rude, arrogant and abnoxious. We ordered breakfast to the room via phone and although it was nice enough they did manage to mix the order up. Asked for brown bread only received white - I appreciate this is only a minor thing, however from after the way we were treated on arrival this just added to our disappointment. Would hesitate to recommend.
reviews.title: The Perfect Dining Experience

reviews.text: We recently visited Dukes hotel on a short break to London and ate in the restraunt, we were not staying in the hotel however we had an amazing meal which I could not fault in any way our whole evening was perfect, the service was outstanding & the food delicious. Thank you to all staff concerned.
reviews.title: We visited the hotel restaurant

reviews.text: The Dukes is my London favorite. Quiet, central location, warm, helpful staff, and nicely appointed rooms.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Terrific Location Wonderful People

reviews.text: I love this hotel and I've probably stayed there at least five times over the past several years. It is hidden away in St. James and is very quiet and peaceful. The rooms are incredibly comfortable, even the smallest accommodation. The bathrooms are beautiful. The service in all ways is friendly and incredibly competent. The dining room is wonderful and they serve THE best English breakfasts. The bar is well known and wonderful. The martinis are simply the best. I highly recommend the Dukes.
reviews.title: My favorite hotel in London!

reviews.text: I never want to go back to London because I don't think I could recreate the awesome two days I spent touring the city and staying at the Dukes. The hotel is in a fabulous location off a charming side street that is easily reached by the London subway. You can quickly get to famous landmarks or hop on the tube to reach attractions on the other side of the city. I especially loved the hotel's lobby area, dining room, and cocktail lounge. I had the best eggs benedict of my life there! Absolutely delicious. In addition to its lovely design, the hotel's rooms are extremely comfortable and the service is impeccable. I highly recommend this hotel if you're looking for a luxury choice in London.
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second visit to Dukes, we just stayed one Saturday night for a quick weekend stay. Staff were very friendly, we were offered a two room upgrade for £25+VAT, breakfast included. Showed to our room and the facilities we were going to use.
reviews.title: What we expected for the price
Difficult
reviews.text: Large bed was very comfortable, the bathroom was small with a very powerful drench shower over the bath but was rather tired and needs upgrading. The shower water leaked through the dated screen on to the floor and this was making the paint work peel off! Didn't bother us that much but if we had been staying longer, we would have complained about it. We did have a toilet blockage problem too but after ringing the front desk about it, they sent someone to sort it straight away and the problem was rectified within fifteen minutes.

description: Awarded “Europe’s Leading Boutique Hotel” and the “World’s Leading Classic Boutique Hotel”, DUKES LONDON is a hidden gem in the heart of St. James Mayfair, where quintessential British charm and the finest luxury mix together to create a timeless atmosphere.
